updates.title: AI Observability for Data Flywheel Blueprint
updates.summary: New blueprint extends NVIDIA AI Blueprint for data flywheels with W&B Weave observability, providing traceability, experiment tracking, evaluation, monitoring for agentic AI workflows, continuous model optimization, quality, latency, cost, safety improvements.[1]

updates.title: What's New Wednesdays - AI Agents Session
updates.summary: Upcoming session on new Weights & Biases features for AI agents workflow, potentially including Weave LLM observability updates.[5]

updates.title: What's New Wednesdays - AI Agents Session
updates.summary: Upcoming session on new Weights & Biases features for AI agents workflow, potentially including Weave LLM observability updates.[5]

updates.title: Product Newsletter: Updates for January 2026
updates.summary: Announcing new W&B feature releases including Weave and Evaluations.[7]

updates.raw_findings:
Changelog from https://app.getbeamer.com/wandb/en: What's new on Weights & Biases, Developer tools for agentic AI applications and models, categories: agents, inference, models, new, registry, rl, w&b training, weave. No specific dated Weave updates extracted.[changelog]

Search results:
[1] NVIDIA blueprint with W&B Weave for AI observability in data flywheels: extends NVIDIA AI Blueprint, adds observability, experiment tracking to agentic AI, traceability, evaluation, monitoring, optimization with real-world data, user feedback. W&B Weave: evaluate, monitor, iterate AI apps, comprehensive evaluations, debugging, production monitoring, secure collaboration.
[2] LLM observability report: W&B Weave logs prompts, outputs, metrics; tracks inputs/outputs/code/metadata; detects hallucinations, latency, security; drift detection; explainability, evaluations, custom scoring, human feedback.
[3] RL observability: W&B Weave for complex AI systems, agentic systems, RL agents; improves quality, latency, cost, safety.
[4] LLM debugging guide: W&B Weave for debugging, tracing, monitoring; custom scorers, dashboards, bias/safety evaluation, monitors, guardrails; future real-time anomaly detection.
[5] What's new Wednesdays: March 2026 NVIDIA GTC, April 29 2026 AI agents new features, May 27 2026 AI agents new features.
[6] LLM articles: Recent tutorials on inference, evaluations, debugging, tracing, monitoring with Weave (Sep 15, Aug 13, etc., 2025 dates).
[7] Product newsletter Jan 2026 updates, new features Weave Evaluations, Feb 02 2026.
[8] Feature releases articles.
[9] GitHub wandb/weave: toolkit for GenAI apps, log/debug LM inputs/outputs.

updates.title: Langfuse CLI
updates.summary: Fully use Langfuse from the CLI. Built for AI agents and power users.

updates.title: Evaluate Individual Operations: Faster, More Precise LLM-as-a-Judge
updates.summary: Observation-level evaluations enable precise operation-specific scoring for production monitoring.

updates.title: Run Experiments on Versioned Datasets
updates.summary: Fetch datasets at specific version timestamps and run experiments on historical dataset versions via UI, API, and SDKs for full reproducibility.

updates.raw_findings: Changelog from https://langfuse.com/changelog lists recent updates including: February 17, 2026 - Langfuse CLI: Fully use Langfuse from the CLI. Built for AI agents and power users. February 13, 2026 - Evaluate Individual Operations: Faster, More Precise LLM-as-a-Judge: Observation-level evaluations enable precise operation-specific scoring for production monitoring. February 11, 2026 - Run Experiments on Versioned Datasets: Fetch datasets at specific version timestamps and run experiments on historical dataset versions via UI, API, and SDKs for full reproducibility. January 14, 2026 - Corrected Outputs for Traces and Observations: Capture improved versions of LLM outputs directly in trace views. Build fine-tuning datasets and drive continuous improvement with domain expert feedback. January 7, 2026 - Inline Comments on Observation I/O: Anchor comments to specific text selections within trace and observation input, output, and metadata fields. December 22, 2025 - Filter Observations by Tool Calls and add Tool Calls to Dashboard Widgets: Add filtering, table columns, and dashboard widgets for analyzing tool usage in your LLM applications. December 17, 2025 - v2 Metrics and Observations API (Beta): New high-performance v2 APIs for metrics and observations with cursor-based pagination, selective field retrieval, and optimized data architecture. December 15, 2025 - Dataset Item Versioning: Track dataset changes over time with automatic versioning on every addition, update, or deletion of dataset items. December 12, 2025 - OpenAI GPT-5.2 support: Langfuse now supports OpenAI GPT-5.2 with day 1 support across all major features. December 11, 2025 - Batch Add Observations to Datasets: Select multiple observations from the observations table and add them to a new or existing dataset with flexible field mapping. And earlier updates down to August 2025. Roadmap at https://langfuse.com/docs/roadmap mentions 10 most recent changelog items: Langfuse CLI(Feb 17, 2026); Evaluate Individual Operations: Faster, More Precise LLM-as-a-Judge; Run Experiments on Versioned Datasets; Corrected Outputs for Traces and Observations; Inline Comments on Observation I/O; Filter Observations by Tool Calls and add Tool Calls to Dashboard Widgets; v2 Metrics and Observations API (Beta); Dataset Item Versioning; OpenAI GPT-5.2 support; Batch Add Observations to Datasets. Active development areas: Agent Observability, Evals, Playground, UI/UX, Infrastructure/Data Platform. Notra changelog https://www.usenotra.com/changelog/langfuse/single-span-evals-and-scores-filtering for February 2â€“13, 2026 mentions: Single-span evaluations moved into open beta, fixes for job queue deadlocks, new filtering for scores API, dashboard charting with Recharts, project-wide table defaults, always-visible playground controls, various PRs like PostHog error handling, dataset item version inference, observation filter options, Tremor to Recharts migration, etc. GitHub discussions https://github.com/orgs/langfuse/discussions/categories/announcements has older announcements like Kubernetes Helm Chart 1.0.0 on Feb 26, 2025, Roadmap 2025 on Jan 13, 2025. Blog post https://langfuse.com/blog/2024-07-ai-agent-observability-with-langfuse last updated February 20, 2026 discusses AI Agent Observability but no specific new updates. Other pages like docs and homepage reiterate changelog items.

ai_comment: W&B Weave strengthened its enterprise security posture by integrating Microsoft Presidio for Python-based PII redaction and expanding audit log capabilities, while Langfuse updated its OpenAI instrumentation to support GPT-5.2.

Weave continues to differentiate with a built-in evaluation visualizer and native hallucination detection guardrails, whereas Langfuse relies on external libraries for safety evaluations and advanced RAG quality metrics.
While Langfuse offers a comprehensive open-source solution, Weave leverages the broader Weights & Biases platform for superior experiment tracking and seamless fine-tuning integration.
